Class HumanDef

java.lang.Object
  PlayerDef
      RetryPlayerDef
          HumanDef

public class HumanDef
extends RetryPlayerDef

This class defines a human Connect-4 player.

Author:
Steven Bogaerts

protected  int getMoveTry()
          Asks the player to enter a move throw the keyboard.
protected  void invalidMoveResponse()
          Prints a message asking the human player to try again, in the event that an invalid move is attempted.

Constructor Detail

HumanDef

public HumanDef()
Create a HumanDef object. Note that setSymbol and setTime must be called before the object can be used. This is done in the Game constructor.

Method Detail

getMoveTry

protected int getMoveTry()
Asks the player to enter a move throw the keyboard. Erroneous input leads to an invalid move to be returned.

Specified by:
getMoveTry in class RetryPlayerDef

invalidMoveResponse

protected void invalidMoveResponse()
Prints a message asking the human player to try again, in the event that an invalid move is attempted.

Specified by:
invalidMoveResponse in class RetryPlayerDef
